meanings.definition: Tod: a fox in its second year.
meanings.sent1: The tods played in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of tods running through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The tods decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her sly smile reminded me of a cunning tod.
meanings.sent5: The tods' red fur glowed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Tod: a unit of weight for wool, usually equal to 28 pounds.
meanings.sent1: The farmer measured the wool in tods.
meanings.sent2: She bought three tods of wool for her knitting project.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the heavy tod of wool was quite a workout.
meanings.sent4: The tods of wool piled up in the corner of the barn.
meanings.sent5: The tods of wool were as heavy as bricks.

meanings.definition: Tod: a small piece or portion.
meanings.sent1: He only ate a tod of the cake.
meanings.sent2: She cut the sandwich into small tods for the kids.
meanings.sent3: The tods of cheese were perfect for snacking.
meanings.sent4: The artist used tiny tods of paint to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The tods of bread were just enough for a quick snack.
